Title: Afterwards to see a cinema show: The diary of a London cinema-goer in 1915
Abstract: © 2015 Taylor & Francis.This article examines the records of cinema-going contained in the unpublished 1915 diary of Archibald Walker, a young, upper-middle-class man about town living in wartime London. It considers the role of cinema in the context of Walkers everyday life, and uses his diary to reconstruct a snapshot of the contemporary entertainment landscape of Londons West End. It then situates cinema in relation to two other West End leisure venues that Walker frequented: the variety theatre and the gentlemens club.
